Daily Dash

ğŸƒâ€â™€ï¸ An offline platformer runner game.

Project Overview

Category Tech Stack Role
Platformer Runner Game C++ + raylib Solo Project

Project Description

This is a solo project I completed during university. The player character runs automatically, dodging enemies and jumping over obstacles to reach the finish line. The gameplay is fast-paced, designed for quick pick-up-and-play sessions and repeated challenges.

Highlights

  • Implemented multi-layered background auto-scrolling to enhance visual dynamism
  • Developed enemy AI logic including movement, collision detection, and trigger mechanisms
  • Designed and built a local leaderboard system to track player scores
  • Used plain text files for data persistence and retrieval

Retrospective

Given the five-week development timeline, I prioritized rapid prototyping to deliver core gameplay features. However, the lack of modular architecture made later feature expansion and maintenance more difficult, highlighting the importance of scalable design.

Next Steps

  • Introduce object pooling to optimize enemy spawning logic, improving performance and resource management efficiency

  • Refactor the project architecture for better modularity and maintainability

  • Add a new sliding animation for the player character to enrich movement dynamics

  • Implement level data loading from local files to support scalable stage design

(Estimated completion: December 2025)

item.description:
About Me

ğŸ¥· A self-taught, semi-wild programmer who came into tech a bit unconventionally.

âŒ¨ï¸ Started out in game development, but curious about many fields.

ğŸ’ Spent years in school – only to realize most of what I know came from self-learning.

ğŸµ Used to love fitness and travel. These days, Iâ€™m all about the cozy indoor life.

ğŸ± Forever an animal lover.

ğŸ“š Forever a book lover.

About This Site

Content

Back when I was more of an artsy type, I enjoyed sharing bits of my personal life. These days, I focus on documenting my learning and work.

The Name: Nullshow

null stands for â€œemptyâ€â€”a reflection of how I view life, and a reminder to always keep a beginnerâ€™s mindset.

show sounds like part of my Chinese name. The pronunciation of Nullshow is close to a childhood nickname, which brings back memories of carefree days.

Illustrations

All category illustrations come from Feng Zikai (1898â€“1975), a pioneer of Chinese comic art. His works are drawn from everyday lifeâ€”simple, expressive, and full of childlike charm. He was from the same hometown as me. Using his art is both a tribute and a reminder to stay mindful of the beauty in daily life, beyond study and work.

Gratitude

This site was built with inspiration and silent help from many brilliant minds online. Itâ€™s made me truly appreciate the power of open-source and sharing. In this era of technological revolution, AI is making everything simpler and faster. I hope Iâ€™m not just swept along by the tide – but riding the wave with intention.

Thanks for joining me on this journey in such an exciting time.
